content: f208 cygnus cowl by meredith collins all efforts were made to make this pattern error-free for questions or support please email info@fairmountfibers com 7/19/23 © fairmount fibers ltd 2023 not to be reproduced or re-knit for profit page 1 of 3 f208 sizes gauge 26 finished circumference x 7½ deep 26 stitches and 37 rounds = 4 in stockinette st on size us4/3 5mm materials 26 stitches and 70 rounds = 4 in stranded colorwork on manos del uruguay sami 100% superwash merino wool size us6/4mm approx 273yds / 100g 1 skip manos del uruguay marla 100% superwash merino wool abbreviations approx 273yds / 100g 1 skip bor beginning of round co cast on shown in sami y2150 bing cherry a and cont continue marla k201 tabac b k knit ndl s needles s us 4/3 5mm 16 circular needle or size needed to obtain repeat s repeats s gauge in stockinette round s round s us 6/4mm 16 circular needle or size needed to obtain gauge st s stitch es in stranded colorwork wy waste yarn spare us 4/3 5mm 16 circular needle or smaller for closing graft notes this cowl is started with a provisional cast-on and knit in the 1 stitch marker round making a long tube when complete the two ends crochet hook for provisional cast-on g/4mm of the tube are brought together and grafted creating a tapestry needle seamless closure waste yarn all efforts were made to make this pattern error-free for questions or support please email info@fairmountfibers com 7/19/23 © fairmount fibers ltd 2023 not to be reproduced or re-knit for profit page 2 of 3 f208 instructions repeat rnds 1-8 of chart b 7 times more for a total of 8 chart with smaller 16 ndl crochet hook and waste yarn reps or 9 ending with round 8 provisionally co 97 sts cut b place bor marker and with a join in the round being careful switch to smaller 16 ndl and with a knit for 4 or desired not to twist length knit 1 round cut a leaving a tail about 50 long for seaming next round k2tog k 95 96 sts finishing switch to larger 16 ndl and joining b work rnds 1-8 of before seaming weave in the ends and block if desired chart a closing the cowl repeat rnds 1-8 of chart a 7 times more for a total of 8 chart carefully thread the spare smaller 16 ndl into the first round of reps or 9 ending with round 8 sts after wy remove wy 96 sts cut a bring both ends of the cowl together matching the co sts with the working sts you will now have two ndls parallel to switch to smaller 16 ndl and with b knit for 4 or desired each other one in front and one behind length with a and tapestry needle graft the cowl closed switch to larger 16 ndl and joining a work rnds 1-8 of chart b knit
